alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 21 at 10:59AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County zone. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:40 AM PDT Friday the stage was 3.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 3.0 Fri 10 am PD 4.3 4.9 5.7 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
